Praet: Expect policy interest rate will remain at present or lower levels for extended period and well past horizon of net asset purchases
Praet: Situation required particularly bold, persistent and steady-handed approach to monetary policy
Praet: Asset purchases strengthen signalling effect of rate forward guidance, rate forward guidance reinforces impact of purchases
Praet: Policy instruments act as strong complements - each instrument has net value that would be diminished if used independently
Praet:  ECB’s non-standard measures induced broad-based easing that spread across variety of asset classes, including bank lending rates
Praet: ECB’s unconventional measures have ensured appropriate degree of accommodation by fostering very favourable financing conditions
Speech Peter Praet: Calibrating unconventional monetary policy https://t.co/gg1vag6EW5
Draghi: Before altering stance need sufficient confidence inflation will converge to our aim & remain even in less supportive conditions
Draghi: I do not see cause to deviate from indications we have been consistently providing in introductory statement
Draghi: Forward guidance relates not just to conditions to withdraw stimulus, also to sequence, for which there is logical basis
Draghi: There are grounds to be cautious on durability of inflation outlook
Draghi: We have established four criteria to confirm a sustained adjustment https://t.co/AMji6HTkI3
Draghi: Yet it is too soon to declare success – still substantial under-utilised resources, labour market slack
Draghi:  Since H2 2015 employment turnaround has extended into formerly stressed economies too
Draghi: 80% of all sectors in all euro area countries have positive growth, above historical average of 73%
Draghi: For virtually first time since start of monetary union, spending has been rising while indebtedness has been going down
Draghi: Around 50% of rise in real labour income since mid-2014 explained by more people in work
Draghi: Collapse in oil prices and our monetary policy explain the resilience of the recovery
Draghi: Euro area growth has accelerated even as world trade has fallen back
Draghi: Since mid-2014 employment has grown by 4.5m people
Draghi: Legacies of financial crisis are still a drag on recovery and global environment remains uncertain
Draghi: ECB monetary policy is working and is key factor behind the resilience of euro area recovery
